Grški parlament je sprejel strožjo azilno zakonodajo
01 Nov 2019, 10:51 by STA

Grški poslanci so zgodaj davi po več kot 14-urni razpravi sprejeli strožjo azilno zakonodajo. Konservativna vlada premierja Kiriakosa Micotakisa želi z novo zakonodajo pospešiti azilni postopek in poenostaviti vračanje nezakonitih migrantov v Turčijo. Do konca leta pa želi 20.000 migrantov preseliti s preobremenjenih grških otokov na celino.



Foto: Pixabay

ATENE > Po novi zakonodaji bodo vsako prošnjo za azil preverili po šestih mesecih namesto po devetih, kot je veljalo doslej. Če prosilci za azil ne bodo sodelovali z oblastmi, pa bodo lahko te prošnjo razglasile za neutemeljeno, poroča nemška tiskovna agencija dpa.
Kiriakos Micotakis je v govoru v parlamentu med drugim znova pozval države članice EU k solidarnosti. “Ni prav, da država koristi ugodnosti EU in se istočasno izogiba tudi najmanjši delitvi bremen,” je poudaril in dodal, da evropska solidarnost ni “a la carte”.
Opozicija ter humanitarne organizacije so novo zakonodajo že pred sprejetjem kritizirale, češ da spodkopava pravico prosilcev za azil do celovite obravnave njihove prošnje.
Po zadnjih podatkih Visokega komisariata ZN za begunce (UNHCR) je v Grčijo letos prispelo 55.348 migrantov in beguncev, od tega 43.683 po morju. Od aprila se je število migrantov v begunskih taboriščih na grških otokih v Egejskem morju s 14.000 povečalo na 35.000. Že aprila je število migrantov občutno presegalo nastanitvene kapacitete, saj je v vseh begunskih centrih skupaj prostora le za približno 7000 prebežnikov. Grška vlada je zato začela del migrantov premeščati na celino.

More stringent asylum legislation passed by Greek Parliament
01 Nov 2019, 10:51 by STA

Greek lawmakers adopted stricter asylum legislation after more than a 14-hour debate early in the day. Prime Minister Kiriakos Micotakis' conservative government wants to accelerate the asylum process with new legislation and facilitate the return of irregular migrants to Turkey. By the end of the year, however, 20,000 migrants are seeking to move from the congested Greek islands to the mainland.



Photo credit: Pixabay

ATHENS> Under new legislation, each asylum application will be reviewed after six months instead of nine, as has been the case so far. If asylum seekers do not cooperate with the authorities, however, they may declare the application unfounded, according to the German news agency dpa.
In a speech to Parliament, Kiriakos Micotakis again called on EU Member States for solidarity. "It is not right for a country to benefit from the EU and at the same time avoid the smallest burden-sharing," he stressed, adding that European solidarity is not a la carte.
The new legislation was criticized by the opposition and humanitarian organizations prior to its adoption, claiming that it undermines the right of asylum seekers to have their application fully addressed.
According to the latest data from the UNHCR, 55,348 migrants and refugees have arrived in Greece this year, 43,683 by sea. Since April, the number of migrants in refugee camps in the Greek Aegean islands has increased from 14,000 to 35,000. Already in April, the number of migrants significantly exceeded the accommodation capacities, with only 7,000 refugees together in all refugee centers. The Greek government therefore began to move part of the migrants to the mainland.
